# textAlignment

**Instance Property**

The technique for aligning the text.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var textAlignment: NSTextAlignment { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property applies to the both the main text string and the placeholder string. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSLeftTextAlignment].

If you are using styled text, assigning a new value to this property causes the text alignment to be applied to the entire string in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextField/attributedText] property. If you want to apply the alignment to only a portion of the text, create a new attributed string with the desired style information and associate it with the text field.

## Configuring the text attributes

- **text**: The text that the text field displays.
- **attributedText**: The styled text that the text field displays.
- **placeholder**: The string that displays when there is no other text in the text field.
- **attributedPlaceholder**: The styled string that displays when there is no other text in the text field.
- **defaultTextAttributes**: The default attributes to apply to the text.
- **font**: The font of the text.
- **textColor**: The color of the text.
- **typingAttributes**: The attributes to apply to new text that the user enters.
- **UITextField.BorderStyle**: The type of border around the text field.
